title: How to Make Oatmeal Raisin Pancakes

steps.headline: Add sugar, vanilla and butter in a large bowl.
steps.description: Place all 3 ingredients into a large mixing bowl and whisk together until well combined.

steps.headline: incorporate milk, oatmeal, raisins and eggs.
steps.description: In the same bowl add the eggs, oatmeal, raisins and eggs. Stir until well combined.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients together.
steps.description: In a separate bowl add baking powder, flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Give it a quick whisk.

steps.headline: Combine wet ingredients with dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the wet ingredients mixture into the dry ingredient mixture. Mix it all together until well combined.

steps.headline: Prepare a frying pan.
steps.description: Heat up some cooking oil over medium heat to prepare the pan for cooking.

steps.headline: Create the pancakes.
steps.description: Measure 1/4 cup of the batter for each pancake. Cook each side for about 3 minutes or until bubbles and the edges start to form.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the freshly made pancakes onto a plate. Drizzle some maple syrup or peanut butter ontop before eating.

text: Add sugar, vanilla and butter in a large bowl. Place all 3 ingredients into a large mixing bowl and whisk together until well combined. incorporate milk, oatmeal, raisins and eggs. In the same bowl add the eggs, oatmeal, raisins and eggs. Stir until well combined. Mix the dry ingredients together. In a separate bowl add baking powder, flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Give it a quick whisk. Combine wet ingredients with dry ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients mixture into the dry ingredient mixture. Mix it all together until well combined. Prepare a frying pan. Heat up some cooking oil over medium heat to prepare the pan for cooking. Create the pancakes. Measure 1/4 cup of the batter for each pancake. Cook each side for about 3 minutes or until bubbles and the edges start to form. Serve. Place the freshly made pancakes onto a plate. Drizzle some maple syrup or peanut butter ontop before eating.
